isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING - HEATER SYSTEM: 2000, 4000, AND 8000 - Before 12/06/1994 - OPERATION

svcsubsecinfo.para: The operation of the Blend-Air system is based on standard automotive heating and air conditioning principles. The air conditioning/heater control unit is shown in Figure 7.

svcproc.title: FRESH AIR VENTILATION
svcproc.para: Fresh air enters the cab through the heater system. Adjust the temperature control knob as required to give the desired degree of ventilation. The full clockwise (blue) position provides the maximum ventilation. Move the AIR OUTLET knob to whichever position provides the desired air flow distribution.

The fan may be used to increase the amount of air entering the cab during ventilation. Adjust the fan speed as desired. Effective approximately January 1, 1993, all 2000, 4000, and 8000 vehicles built with heater only will have three dash registers. The registers will be located: one on the driver side and two in the center of the dash. The register on the right side of the dash will still be plugged because there is no way to provide ventilation to that dash outlet. These registers will operate only in the VENT mode.
